Montenegro claimed victory, but it could have been a little more humble because the municipal victory was tangential and lost many important Chambers such as Braga and Coimbra. The people, this time, showed great civic sense and abstention was one of the lowest in electoral history. At many polling stations the queues were huge and the wait was very long. It was the translation that abstention would download. Even so, the fraud did not cease to exist. In one region of the country, the old illegality of a party having had voting slips printed similar to those given to voters and then proposing that their appeased parties carry a ballot in their pocket with a cross in the party in question and when they brought the blank ballot that the polling station had delivered, they would receive two thousand euros. Not bad for a few thousand “mercenaries”. The people are fed up with elections, but nothing about the matter is going to end. The spearheads of the candidates for President of the Republic are already on the road. The variety is huge, but almost all in the same direction. On the center right we have Admiral Gouveia e Melo with Marques Mendes. Even further to the right appears the “bocas” André Ventura and Cotrim Figueiredo, who was leader of the Liberal Initiative. On the moderate left side, António José Seguro appeared and it was only last Saturday that the Socialist Party decided to officially support the candidate António José Seguro. Too late. And even so, the leftmost socialist wing will vote for António Filipe of the PCP, in the good style of Álvaro Cunhal, who suggested that sometimes you have to cover your eyes to vote for someone who doesn't belong to the party. This time, the polls seem to be getting it right. A polling company, in which we have the greatest confidence, obtained in a national survey carried out last week, that there will be a second round between Gouveia e Melo and António José Seguro. However, when the respondents were faced with the final decision in the second round, victory fell to the admiral. Because, just as we wrote last Monday, Luís Montenegro, with this municipal victory, will not resign, even if the Public Ministry opens a judicial inquiry against the current prime minister regarding the case of his family company Spinumviva. The man has been in politics for many years and knows everything about how to defend himself against suspicions of alleged scammers. Portugal will continue to be governed by a politician under serious suspicion, but that in no way affects his unhealthy desire to be head of the Executive.

item.title: What direction for Macau in 2026?
item.description: Only people from abroad will be surprised by the announcement of the list of seven deputies appointed by the Chief Executive to the 8th legislature of the Legislative Assembly. As one commentator highlighted, the personnel change is part of a “chess game”, aimed at further improving the constitutional structure with a predominance of the executive branch, under the principle of “One Country, Two Systems”, and at strengthening the functions of the administrative, legislative and judicial bodies, as well as deepening their constructive interaction. Given the effectiveness of the consultative policy that has long been in force in Macau, the chance of Cheong Weng Chon (appointed by the Chief Executive to be a deputy of the Legislative Assembly) being elected President or Vice-President of the 8th legislature of the Legislative Assembly on October 16th, in the first session of the Plenary, is very high. It is difficult to imagine how Cheong, who was Secretary for Administration and Justice, could avoid embarrassing situations in the upcoming sectoral debates on the Lines of Government Action, especially when they focus on the area of ​​administration and justice, if he simply limited himself to being a deputy. If elected President of the Assembly, embarrassing situations can be avoided. The three former Chief Executives of Macau, Ho Hau Wah, Chui Sai On and Ho Iat Seng, were all part of the Legislative Assembly. Ho Iat Seng, with his experience as President of the Assembly, understood very well the type of problems generated in administrative departments. After taking office as Chief Executive, Ho actually carried out in-depth work to optimize the efficiency of the administrative structure. After Macau's return to Chinese sovereignty, Cheong Weng Chon was Director of the Justice Affairs Bureau, Commissioner against Corruption, Secretary for Administration and Justice and Head of the Executive Committee of the Guangdong-Macao In-depth Cooperation Zone in Hengqin, so he is well versed in administrative matters. His frequent interactions with the Legislative Assembly during the law-making process allowed him to gain a good understanding of the capabilities and performance of deputies. If Cheong leads the 8th term of the Legislative Assembly, he will undoubtedly set a precedent for the full realization of the predominance of the executive branch under the principle of “One Country, Two Systems”. Macau, a small city with about 700,000 inhabitants and an area of ​​33.3 square kilometers, was entrusted with the task of transforming the In-depth Cooperation Zone between Guangdong and Macau on Hengqin Island, into the new trade center of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area and the new platform for China's opening up to the outside world. As long as annual gaming revenue can remain at MOP240 billion, the SAR Government can make ends meet and provide for the basic needs of Macau residents. The problems facing public servants and small and medium-sized businesses can be resolved. A focus is needed on creating an environment that promotes business in public spaces, developing more employment opportunities for residents and investing in economic construction. The direction Macau will take in 2026 will be influenced by changes in neighboring areas. Barring unforeseen circumstances, Sanae Takaichi, who follows in the footsteps of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, will be the first woman to hold that position and will be elected at an extraordinary session of the Japanese Diet called for October 15. News indicates that US President Donald Trump will visit Japan between October 27th and 29th to meet with the Emperor and the new Prime Minister. Furthermore, the fourth plenary session of the 20th. Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) will take place in Beijing from October 20th to 23rd. This chain of interactions, which was certainly not planned, suggests the inerception of a powerful hand. At the reception commemorating the 80th anniversary of China's victory in the War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression, President Xi Jinping stated that China is a force for world peace. If this strength comes into play, Macau can still sail smoothly into 2026.

item.title: In Memoriam by Chef António Coelho
item.description: “I love Portuguese food. I love the traditional and authentic cuisine. It’s the one I learned in Portugal. For me, that’s very important because I prefer the traditional things.” Chef António Neves Coelho The guardian of Portuguese-Macanese cuisine and dear friend, Chef António das Neves Coelho, left us on October 12, 2025, at Hospital Conde de São Januário. Major figure of Portuguese gastronomy in Macau, mentor to generations, defender of culinary authenticity and symbol of institutional resilience. His departure represents an irreparable loss for the gastronomic culture of the Macao SAR and for the emotional memory of all who shared his table, kitchen and dreams with him. Chef António grew up amidst the aromas of olive oil, garlic and red wine. From an early age, he revealed a rare vocation for cooking, not just as a technique, but as a cultural narrative. His training took place in emblematic houses of Portuguese gastronomy, where he learned to respect the ingredients, times and affections that make up the culinary tradition. His international career took him to three continents and, finally, to Macau, where he completed his military service and found his true stage. From 1997 onwards, he established himself as Executive Chef and operations manager in reference spaces, becoming one of the main ambassadors of Portuguese and Macanese cuisine. Macau was not only his professional destination but his spiritual home. António understood that Macanese cuisine is not just a fusion of flavors, but also of stories. With sensitivity and rigor, he became a defender of the preservation of traditional recipes, the valorization of local ingredients and the formation of multicultural teams with a spirit of mission. He founded his own brand, where he worked as culinary director and general manager for more than a decade at António Restaurante, receiving 12 Michelin recommendations, among others. His leadership was marked by a rare combination of technical demands, human empathy and strategic vision. His cuisine was made of olive oil and affection, of technique and tenderness, of rigor and poetry. Its contribution was recognized by two highly prestigious distinctions such as the Medal of Tourist Merit, awarded by the Government of the Macao SAR, in recognition of its role in the development of the hospitality sector and local gastronomic culture and the Medal of Merit of Portuguese Communities, awarded by the Government of Portugal, for its action as a cultural bridge between continents and for the promotion of Portuguese identity abroad. These honors were not just trophies but testimonies of his dedication to the public cause, culture and excellence. In 2024, Chef António took on the leadership of a new gastronomic project at Angela Café & Lounge at Lisboeta Macau. There, he created a menu that celebrated the Portuguese and Macanese essence, with dishes such as codfish à lagareiro, seafood rice and desserts with a conventual touch. The space has become a meeting point between tradition and modernity, between tourists and locals, between memory and the future. His team, formed and inspired by him, continues to represent the pillars of his vision with dedication, creativity and commitment to excellence. Chef António's death represents a human and institutional loss of great significance. But his legacy remains alive in the memory of the customers who tasted his dishes; in the training of professionals who learned from him; in the institutional identity of the spaces he helped to build and in the gastronomic culture of Macau and the Portuguese diaspora His work does not end with his departure but continues in each preserved recipe, in each technical gesture transmitted and in each ethical value defended. More than a Chef, António was the guardian of the Portuguese-Macanese gastronomic soul. His life was a bridge between continents, flavors and generations. His cuisine was made of memory and innovation, of technique and tenderness, of rigor and poetry. May his memory continue to live on in every dish served, in every story told and in every young professional who dares to dream of a cuisine that respects the past and transforms the present. Before his departure, Chef António left his legatee a precious set of recipes that are not mere technical records, but authentic trophies of Portuguese cuisine, honed over decades of practice, reflection and passion. This legacy is not just a gastronomic collection but a cultural heritage, a letter of intent and a mission to fulfill. Each recipe represents a chapter of your life, a shared memory, a silent tribute to the roots that formed you. These are dishes that carry the flavor of childhood, the rigor of classical training, the boldness of reinvention and the tenderness of maturity. These are formulas that are not limited to ingredients and quantities as they contain gestures, silences, waiting times, and above all, intention. The legatee, chosen with discernment and trust, did not just receive a recipe book. He received a culinary testament, a map of values ​​and institutional responsibility. It will now be up to you to execute, preserve and reinterpret these creations with fidelity and courage, keeping the flame of authenticity alive without falling into the rigidity of repetition. In the Portuguese tradition, the transmission of recipes is an act of intimacy and respect. It's not just about teaching but about trust. Chef António understood this deeply. For this reason, the recipes he left were not disseminated en masse, nor transformed into a commercial product. They were given to those who knew how to understand his spirit, to those who shared his daily kitchen with him and to those who demonstrated technical ability and human sensitivity. These recipes include classic dishes and conventual desserts reinterpreted with local ingredients. But they also include new creations, designed for special occasions, themed menus and cultural tributes. These are dishes that never reached the public, but that can now be revealed with the care they deserve. Executing these recipes is not just reproducing flavors but embodying a philosophy. The legatee will have to maintain a balance between fidelity and evolution, technique and emotion, tradition and contemporaneity. You will have to respect the times, the gestures, the silences that Chef António taught. You will have to understand that each dish is also a message, a memory and an affirmation of identity. More than cooking, it will have to cure in a museological and emotional sense. Curate the legacy, protect it from trivialization and present it with dignity. You will have to train others, transmit the values ​​you received, ensure that the legacy does not disappear over time, but multiplies with meaning. This work is not just gastronomic but curatorial, educational and diplomatic. It is a way of affirming that cuisine is also culture, that the dish is also a document and that the flavor is also memory. The recipes left by Chef António are seeds. It is now up to the legatee and the institution involved to cultivate them with respect, water them with knowledge and make them flourish with creativity. Each time one of these recipes is served, it will be as if Chef António were present not as a shadow, but as a light. This legacy is a rare gift. And like any precious gift, it requires care, time and love. May it be honored with the same generosity with which it was conceived. May it be shared with the same elegance with which it was lived. May it be perpetuated with the same passion with which it was created. Because in the kitchen, as in life, what remains is not what is repeated, it is what is respected.

item.title: Lusofonia Festival | Calema, from São Tomé, performs this Saturday
item.description: The Calema concert takes place this weekend in another edition of the Lusofonia Festival. The brother and sister duo will take the stage at Casas Museu da Taipa on Saturday, starting at 9:30 pm. There are, however, sounds from other countries in the Lusophony universe, such as Rui Orlando, from Angola performing on Sunday or Memu Sunhu, Carimbó Paidégua and Negros Unidos, a group from Equatorial Guinea They are the brothers António and Fradique Mendes Ferreira and together they make up Calema. Originally from São Tomé and Príncipe, and residing in Portugal, the two brothers are traveling to Macau this week to participate in another edition of the popular Lusofonia Festival. The lights and music are felt on the stage at Casas Museu da Taipa, this Saturday, from 9:30 pm, in a show with free entry. In Portugal, the Calema have been a success story. They started their career around 15 years ago and have performed on impressive stages such as Estádio da Luz and at dozens of music festivals. The first album was released in 2010, entitled “Ni Mondja Anguené”, followed by “Bomu Kêlê”, released in 2014, and “A Nossa Vez”, in 2017. This is followed by “Yellow Voyage”, released in 2020″, and “Voyage – Part II”, released four years later, and “Voyage – Part III”. In 2019, an album arrived that seems to be a kind of consecration, when the duo released “Ao Vivo no Campo Pequeno”, one of the most important concert halls in Lisbon. The single “Maria Joana”, recorded with singers Nuno Ribeiro and fado singer Mariza, released more recently, won the Play – Portuguese Music Awards in the Song of the Year category. But Calema have been immersed in solidarity projects, going beyond music. One of the examples is the fact that, in August this year, the duo received the designation of goodwill ambassadors of the Community of Portuguese Speaking Countries (CPLP) in the area of ​​culture and music, having stressed that they want to be an example for young people. "When we were starting out, we didn't have any example because everything seemed very difficult. (…) I think, in a certain way, you can show them [young people] that it is possible, that there is a process and that if you work, if you believe, your dream can come true, but it depends a lot on you. It's that light that we want", declared Fradique Mendes Ferreira to Lusa, upon receiving this appointment. António Mendes Ferreira stressed that the appointment of CPLP ambassadors is a source of pride. "We have always made music with the aim of making people happy, communicating with them, connecting with them, and being part of this family that is CPLP is incredible. We have grown within the community and its culture", said António. Other sounds The Lusofonia stage will be filled with other sounds in the Portuguese language, as is the case of Rui Orlando, who will perform on Sunday, 26th, from 8:40 pm. Originally from Angola, Rui is a musician, composer and instrumentalist, having won the television competition “Angola Encanta” in 2011. Rui Orlando has a degree in accounting and management, but his passion for music won. At the age of 20, he took an intensive course in Lisbon and there he began to dedicate himself to his artistic career. Memu Sunhu arrives from Guinea-Bissau, who will perform this Friday from 8:40 pm. This is a very recent group, formed in 2021 by four musicians: Ninanca Alfredo Carlos Banca, Desejado Carlos Gomes Sadjó, Sadibo Coté and Malam Djudju Mané. The collective is known for mixing different musical genres with the more traditional music of Guinea-Bissau. From Brazil, Carimbó Paidégua also arrives, who will perform on Sunday from 7:10 pm. This band is a collective researching music and dances linked to the Amazon rainforest and is based in the city of São Paulo. Also noteworthy is the performance of Negros Unidos, coming from Equatorial Guinea, with a performance scheduled for Saturday from 7:55 pm. The Lusofonia festival continues the following weekend with more musical performances, gastronomy and craft spaces. With Lusa

item.title: Albergue SCM hosts 11th Halloween party this weekend
item.description: Taking place this Saturday and Sunday, the 25th and 26th of October, the “11th Halloween Albergue SCM”, with various activities for children and adults, which promises to transport the public “to a world of pumpkins and captivating Halloween festivities”. According to a note from Albergue da Santa Casa da Misericórdia, this year's event has the theme “Ghost Party”, including the “Spider Tunnel” activity and a variety of “ghostly decorations”. Thus, at the beginning of the evening, there will be “free makeup stalls, clown performances and an exciting challenge in the ‘Haunted House of Cockroaches’ in the Albergue SCM square, suitable for participants of all ages”. In addition, between 3pm and 6pm, the activity “Albergue SCM – Let’s Trick or Treat” will be presented, an “exciting event that invites children aged 5 to 12, accompanied by an adult, to embark on an exciting adventure, in search of hidden treasures in the São Lázaro neighborhood”. Here, participants are equipped with a map and can explore “unique streets and alleys, collecting ‘mysterious patterns’ and being able to win delicious sweets on the return to Albergue SCM”. 11 years of celebration Another highlight is the holding, between Saturday and Tuesday, of the “Albergue SCM Halloween Costume Competition”, in which, in order to win prizes, participants have to take a photo of their costume inside the Hostel space, sharing and commenting on the image on social media. The comment with the most likes will receive a prize. For the event organizers, “Halloween is not only a festival that celebrates the autumn harvest, but also a platform for global cultural exchange”. For these activities, prior registration is required through Albergue SCM's official contacts or on social media. It was in 2013 that Albergue SCM, through CAC – Círculo de Amigos da Cultura, began celebrating Halloween, with the support of the Macau Cultural Institute.

item.title: FRC | Debate on new Investment Funds law this Wednesday
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) and MBtv Debates, linked to Macau Business magazine, will present this Wednesday the conference “New Law on Investment Funds in Macau: Perspectives, Opportunities and Challenges”, at the Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC). The event is part of MBtv’s “Finance Series” conversation cycle. According to a statement from the FRC, this new legislation, and the reform it entails, “aims to improve the city's value proposition, diversify the economy and mobilize underutilized capital funds, through the modernization of the legal framework”. "What will it take to transform the law into a real market boost? Where are the opportunities in product design, management, distribution and fund administration?", ask the organizers. Therefore, a “distinct panel of political decision-makers, sector leaders and legal experts will analyze the prospects, opportunities and future challenges” of the Macao SAR's financial situation. Present at the debate will be Amy Ho, senior banking analyst, linked to the Macau Monetary Authority; Bernardo Alves, president and investment director of A&P Investment Fund Management Company Limited; Calvin Chui, managing partner of the law firm Lektou and chairman of the Board of Directors of the Macau Financial Law Association. Also participating are Gavin Kwok, director of prime brokerage sales at Maybank Investment Banking Group, in Hong Kong; Rui Proença, partner at the law firm MdME and Nuno Sardinha da Mata, senior partner at C&C Advogados. The session will be moderated by the director of Macau Business and Macau News Agency, José Carlos Matias.

item.title: Lisbon | Eric Fok presents “Great Voyage Nº 1” in group exhibition
item.description: Living in Portugal, local artist Eric Fok is one of the artists participating in the collective exhibition “Drawing Room Lisboa 2025”, presenting the piece “Great Voyage Nº 1” alongside the works of Clara Leitão, João Castro Silva and Nicoleta Sandulescu. To see at the National Society of Fine Arts This week, an art fair entitled “Drawing Room Lisboa 2025” is taking place in Lisbon, hosted by the National Society of Fine Arts between Thursday and Sunday, and which features the participation of Macau artist Eric Fok, currently residing in Portugal. Furthermore, the public can also see works by other artists, namely Clara Leitão, João Castro Silva and Nicoleta Sandulescu. Born in the territory during the period of Portuguese administration, in 1990, Eric Fok “transforms historical maps into compositions that focus on the relationship between the past and the present, also reflecting on his own identity”, highlights a note from the organization. The artist presents “a detailed line in isographic pen”, drawing “cartographies that start from the history of the age of discovery, investigate the changes in cities caused by urban development and discuss post-colonial phenomena”. The work presented at this fair is entitled “Great Voyage Nº1” and, according to a note written by the artist himself, “depicts the arch of Praça do Comércio, symbolizing the ancient Portuguese royalty and the era of great navigation”. "As a pioneer of the Age of Discoveries, Portugal, driven by technology and faith, enabled contact between people from different continents, allowing the world's diverse cultures to be mutually discovered. Macau also participated in this process of globalization in the 16th century, being a meeting point between East and West, where cultural and species exchanges shaped the world we know today", he highlighted. The painting uses a “door” that serves as a frame, “symbolizing the connection between two places, as if the viewer crossed the door to reach another world, another culture”. Furthermore, Eric Fok described, “there are different animals on the door, including the octopus, which symbolizes maritime culture and the exploration of the unknown by humans, and animals representing different regions, such as the giraffe from Africa and the rhino from Central Asia”. “These animals also refer to the participation of animals in the Age of Discoveries and Noah's Ark. Inside the door, there is the map of Portugal, a point of convergence of faces and cultures”, he highlighted in the same note. Between Lisbon and the Biennale In addition to participating in this exhibition, Eric Fok also has a new project related to Macau on his hands, taking into account that he is co-author of the work “Polifonia de Jacone”, alongside O Chi Wai and Lei Fung Ieng. This is the project chosen to represent the Macao SAR at the 61st Venice Art Biennale next year. “Polyphony of Jacone” is curated by Feng Yan and Ng Sio Ieng and refers to the life of the Chinese artist Wu Li, whose Portuguese name was Jacone and who studied theology in Macau at the beginning of the Qing dynasty. In an interview with the Lusa agency last year, Eric Fok confessed that he moved to Portugal when, in Macau, he “stopped knowing how to smile”. At the age of 34, when Eric Fok wanted to leave, Portugal made perfect sense, for historical and work reasons, for the “feeling of closeness”. And other European countries don't know Macau, he admitted in the interview. “I also hope that my works reach other places, such as Europe, are known by more people and come closer to the scope of my creation”, he says. Fok, graduated in Visual Arts from the then Macau Polytechnic Institute (currently the Macau Polytechnic University) and with a master's degree in Fine Arts completed at the National Taiwan University, is a kind of artist-cartographer. At the beginning of Fok's career, Macau found himself amidst “rapid changes”, following the territory's transition to China and the liberalization of the gaming sector, which contributed to the rapid growth of the local economy. Fok took this new city and explored it. In one of the paintings, painted around ten years ago, he discussed the construction of the territory's first metro line, “with constant delays and slippage”. He wrote down “the foundations of the metro, as if they were ancient Greco-Roman ruins”. Then, this avid history consumer wanted to know about other worlds. This was followed by “the era of geographical discoveries, including globalization, as well as colonialism, and in modern times, the effects of the Cold War, waves of immigration”, he recalls.

item.title: UM / Law | Study highlights “success” of bilingual degrees
item.description: A study developed by three professors from the Faculty of Law of the University of Macau speaks of the “success” of bilingual degrees in this area, arguing that it can serve as a “model”. Another conclusion is that almost half of the students on the course achieved a better level of Portuguese with a period of study in Portugal compared to those who stayed in Macau The degree in Chinese-Portuguese Law from the University of Macau (UM) is seen as a success story and an example to be taken into account in the local academy. This is one of the conclusions of the study “Experiences in Bilingual Legal Education: The Case of Macau SAR’s Chinese–Portuguese Bachelor of Law”, authored by professors Teresa Lancry Robalo, Cheng Hang Leong and João Ilhão Moreira, from the UM Faculty of Law. The authors speak of the “success” of this degree program, which “combines rigorous legal training with strategic linguistic immersion”, consisting of a “model for bilingual legal education”. It is further argued that this degree constitutes “a model for other jurisdictions seeking to develop bilingual or multilingual legal education, regardless of whether they operate in bilingual systems”. The study analyzes a decade of data, from 2014 to 2024, and a universe of 333 students. In ten years “the program has graduated 99 bilingual students, with flexibility that allows transfers to a Chinese-only course if linguistic benchmarks are not met.” The fact that 99 students on the course completed the course “demonstrates the program’s ability to train legal professionals in both Chinese and Portuguese”, argue the authors. Furthermore, there were “67 students considered to have not achieved sufficient bilingual proficiency”, and who went “on to the Bachelor of Laws in Chinese, graduating from that program”, it is said. In this way, it is considered that, “after a decade of implementation and five groups of graduates entering the job market, the program has proven that it can meet its ambitious objectives and demonstrated that effective bilingual legal education is possible, even in jurisdictions where one of the legal languages ​​is not widely spoken by the population”, it reads. Question of languages Another conclusion of the study relates to the greater benefits obtained by students who choose to study Portuguese in Portugal. This is because “48.77 percent of students who studied in Portugal achieved B2 proficiency” in Portuguese, which in the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages ​​means an “independent user”, someone capable of understanding the essential ideas of a more complex text, and having dialogue with some spontaneity with native speakers. Meanwhile, only 20.83 percent of students who remained in Macau reached this level of proficiency in Portuguese. The study highlights that “the Covid-19 pandemic interrupted international mobility, drastically reducing proficiency gains in affected classes”. The analysis carried out in the study shows that the highest graduation rate “was recorded in the inaugural year of the program (2014-2015), with 96.43 percent of enrolled students graduating”. For the authors, this is an “exceptional result”, which “can be attributed to the use of a more flexible definition of bilingual proficiency during the initial implementation of the program”. On the contrary, “the lowest graduation rate occurred in the 2019-2020 academic year, with only 13.64 percent of enrolled students completing the program.” The study describes that “a likely reason for this decline is the restrictions imposed during Covid-19”. But there is a “challenge” in the midst of success: the fact that “some graduates have varying levels of proficiency in Portuguese, which proves the need for continuous improvement of teaching methods”, and “the incorporation of new technological approaches, which can help to overcome these obstacles”, must be considered. In the degree in Chinese-Portuguese Law, the first year consists of basic subjects such as Introduction to Law or History of Law, and then students “begin intensive linguistic training, with a curriculum aimed at developing oral and written proficiency”, with a focus on oral and written comprehension. In the second year, there is a focus on learning the language, whether in Macau or Portugal, and in the following three years “students continue their studies with a combination of Law subjects taught in both languages”, with students on the bilingual course “not attending separate classes, but rather classes from the Bachelor of Laws programs in Chinese and Bachelor of Laws in Portuguese”. The study authors make several suggestions, such as the idea that “institutions could introduce an additional bilingual program with minimal incremental costs, improving their academic offering and attracting a wider group of potential students”.

item.title: C-PLPEX with a record number of Portuguese-speaking exhibitors and Pelé’s “iconic shirt”
item.description: The China-Portuguese-Speaking Countries Economic and Commercial Exhibition (C-PLPEX) kicks off today in Macau, with 320 Portuguese-speaking exhibitors and, in a “sporting touch”, the exhibition of the iconic shirt worn by Pelé in the 1962 World Cup. In the second edition of C-PLPEX, Deep Robotics, a Chinese innovation company founded in 2017, will present two robot dogs. These are “very mature products”, which can, for example, be sent to assess the situation in a fire scenario, a representative of the BPS Global Group, Deep Robotics agent in Australia, Hong Kong and Macau, explained to journalists. With its participation in C-PLPEX, highlighted Wong, the company has “Macau as a priority”, but doors can open to other latitudes. “We need to know if Portuguese-speaking countries are interested and if the parent company has any plans to expand and to which Portuguese-speaking countries”, added the person in charge, during a visit by journalists to the fair site, which runs until Saturday. Deep Robotics will occupy one of the almost 500 exhibitors from China and Portuguese-speaking countries present this year at C-PLPEX. There were 320 exhibitors in the Portuguese-speaking world alone, which represents “an increase of 23 percent compared to the first edition”, announced, at a press conference, the president of the Macau Trade and Investment Promotion Institute (IPIM). “A third are from Brazil, a third from Portugal and the rest are from [other] Portuguese-speaking countries”, added Che Weng Keong. Years of debuts In parallel, this year, for the first time, the China-Portuguese Speaking Countries International Agricultural Expo will take place. Brazil, considered the person responsible for IPIM, weighed in on the decision to launch this new exhibition. "Brazil is a very large country, linked to food production, agricultural production and, taking this into consideration, we decided to hold this exhibition. In the interior of China, this [agricultural] area is very advanced and can have a good relationship with Portuguese-speaking countries", explained the president of IPIM. Alan Ho, coordinator of C-PLPEX, also noted that bringing “many people” from the Portuguese-speaking world and the interior of China to Macau is “crucial to promoting the Macau platform”. In a “sporting and cultural touch” of this fair, continued Alan Ho, this year “the yellow number 10 jersey worn by Pelé in 1962” will be displayed “for the first time in Macau” during the World Cup.

item.title: JP Morgan | “Surprising recovery” highlighted after Golden Week
item.description: After a disappointing start to the month, the game's latest numbers are surprising analysts. With average revenues of 781 million patacas per day, the sector shows that Golden Week was an accident of course, and not the trend The game's gross revenues saw a “surprising recovery” after Golden Week, with the first 19 days of October generating 14.85 billion patacas. The scenario was outlined by the investment bank JP Morgan, in a report cited by the GGR Asia portal. According to the financial services institution, the most recent week saw a “surprising recovery” in revenue, to an average daily level of 781 million patacas. This amount means an increase of 25 percent compared to the second week of this month, when average revenue per day did not exceed 593 million patacas. Analysts DS Kim, Selina Li and Lindsey Qian also downplayed the fact that revenues during Golden Week were lower than expected, considering that it was a sporadic event rather than an industry trend: “We continue to believe that the weak performance in Golden Week [in October] was an isolated episode and not a trend, probably due to the typhoon [Matmo], the festival calendar of the moon cake, and the F1 race in Singapore. Events that all occurred during the Golden Week holidays,” said JP Morgan analysts. Could be better At the same time, JP Morgan admits that the latest revision of growth forecasts for October may be below the actual value, due to the latest figures, which show a better trend than expected. "We adjusted our forecast for gross gaming revenue for October to a growth of between three and six percent compared to the same period last year, following Golden Week. However, this adjustment now presents risks, given the strong and surprising recovery last week", he was justified. The investment bank also forecasts revenue growth during the period between October and December of 10 percent, compared to the same period last year. In relation to the beginning of 2026, forecasts point to an expansion of the sector “a little” above the 10 percent value, which should be around 13 percent in terms of pre-tax revenue.

item.title: Taipa | Request for intervention on trees in abandoned houses
item.description: There are two trees growing between the roof and walls of two abandoned houses in the Taipa Velha area, namely on Rua dos Bem Casados, which could pose a risk to public safety. According to the Ou Mun newspaper, the Taipa Community Development Promotion Association hopes that there will be a public interdepartmental working group to analyze the risks of the growth of these trees in order to contact the house owners to find a solution. The association also wishes that the intervention can take place even if it is not possible to contact the owners. Lam Ka Chun, vice-president of the association, referred to residents' complaints about the large branches of these trees, which reach the chimneys of the buildings opposite, and which in summer attract flying white ants. During the rainy season, trees can grow even larger, causing cracks in walls, collapsing structures, infiltration and harming residents and passersby. The person responsible recalled that the common practice, in similar cases, is for the owners themselves to clean the place, taking into account that the trees grow in spaces that are private property. However, there are properties that have been abandoned for many years, making it difficult to find or contact the owners, recalled Lam Ka Chun.

item.title: Camões Garden | Treadmill disappeared within hours
item.description: Hours after photos of the new pedestrian crossing at Calçada do Botelho began to circulate on social media, and with several internet users ridiculing the crossing, DSAT admitted to having gone back on its original intention A few hours arrived for the Government to create and eliminate a temporary walkway on the Calçada do Botelho slope. The case happened on Monday, sparked controversy on social media, and was enough for the Directorate of Services for Traffic Affairs (DSAT) to back down on its intention to install a zebra crossing near Jardim de Camões. The case emerged on Monday morning, on social media, when photographs began to appear of workers installing a new pedestrian crossing at the top of the climb for those traveling from Calçada do Botelho, towards Porto Interior-Jardim de Camões. However, the images went viral on social media, with several internet users criticizing the location of the new pedestrian crossing, as they considered that being placed at the top of a hill, for those traveling from Porto Interior, poses extra difficulties for drivers. Among the criticisms, there were also internet users who indicated that several buses circulate in that area, often completely full, so it would be counterproductive to force vehicle drivers to have to stop in that place, to give way to pedestrians. In addition to criticism in the form of comments, several satirical images also began to appear. In one of the publications it was possible to see the suggestion to install toll gates on site. This was a way of criticizing the recent proposal by Leong Chi Hang, Government advisor on traffic matters, who defended the installation of tolls on all bridges in the territory. There were also those who used artificial intelligence to post images of the metro running along Calçada do Botelho. Quick response Hours after the criticism, the crossing was removed from the site, and DSAT issued a statement explaining what had happened and admitting that the clarification was made in light of the various comments that appeared online. According to DSAT, since yesterday work began near Praça de Camões to install conduits for electricity and telecommunications cables and the passage of water pipes. For this reason, there was a need to temporarily modify the crossings on site, which led to the installation of the crossing at Calçada do Botelho. However, DSAT admitted that following the comments, an on-site inspection was carried out on site, in coordination with the police and the contractor, which led to the zebra crossing being removed, hours after being installed. The temporary walkway was therefore placed close to the Church of Santo António.

item.title: Chikungunya | Two more imported cases
item.description: The Health Services (SS) announced the registration of two more imported cases of Chikungunya fever, which increases the number of cases imported since the beginning of the year to 26. According to information from the SS, as has been the case with most cases, the 25th infection was imported from the Interior, by a resident who was in Zhongshan, between 23 September and 15 October. When he returned to Macau, he began to feel headaches and fatigue, and on the 16th, he developed symptoms of fever and a rash on his arms and joints. She went to the Conde de São Januário Hospital Center where she was diagnosed with Chikungunya fever. The second case was detected in a local resident, who visited the city of Shunde on 7 October. On the night of the 13th, he developed fatigue and joint pain and on the 14th he developed a rash. He went to the Fai Chi Kei Health Center on the 17th and was also diagnosed with the disease. Both are in a state considered stable. Dengue | New imported case disclosed The Health Services (SS) announced a new case of dengue fever, which increases the number of imported cases since the beginning of the year to 19. According to official information, the patient is 12 years old and was in Zhongshan on the 6th and 7th of October. After returning to Macau, he developed symptoms such as fever and fatigue on the night of October 13th. On the 15th, he went to the Conde São Januário Hospital Center, where he was admitted. The diagnosis was made two days later. "Currently, the patient's clinical condition is stable. The people with whom he lives do not present any indisposition", the SS reported. “According to the patient's travel history, the date of onset of symptoms and the results of laboratory tests, the case was classified as imported […] The Health Services will send personnel to carry out the preventive elimination of mosquitoes in the areas surrounding the patient's residence and main places of activity”, it was added.

item.title: Traffic | Collision between bus and truck leaves five injured
item.description: The injured ranged in age from 20 to 67 and included residents, non-resident workers and tourists. The accident occurred when the truck driver was unable to brake in time to avoid colliding with the back of the bus, which was stopped to give way to the zebra crossing. A total of five people had to be transported to different hospitals following a collision between a bus and a truck yesterday morning. The case happened on Avenida do Aeroporto, near the Wynn Palace casino, after the truck that was following behind the bus was unable to brake in time to avoid the collision. According to the Ou Mun newspaper, the Fire Department (CB) revealed that the injured are between 20 and 67 years old, and include residents, non-resident workers from the Interior and even tourists from the Interior. At the time of the accident, all the injured were inside the bus, where they were passengers. The injuries are considered minor, but include abrasions and bruises on different parts of the body. The victims of the accident were transported to the Taipa Medical Center of Kiang Hospital and to Kiang Wu Hospital itself, on the Macau Peninsula. Although the injuries were considered minor, at around 1 pm the victims were still in the health institutions to which they had been taken. No alcohol in the blood According to authorities, the accident happened around 9:50 am, when the bus was following another private vehicle. The driver of the heavy passenger vehicle tried to change lanes, but was forced to brake, as the vehicle in front of him stopped to give way to some pedestrians who were crossing the zebra crossing. However, the braking took the truck driver by surprise, who was unable to brake in time and ended up hitting the bus in the rear. As a result of the impact, the truck had damage to the front, with the front window and bumper showing visible signs of the impact. The bus was damaged at the rear. The truck driver is a local resident in his 70s. He took the balloon test and did not report alcohol consumption. The bus driver is also a resident, aged 50, and had also not consumed alcohol. In reaction to the accident, the company Transportes Urbanos de Macau (Transmac) issued a statement, cited by the newspaper Ou Mun, indicating that it was monitoring the case. The company also guaranteed that after being alerted to what had happened, it activated the response means, notifying the police of the incident and promising all availability to cooperate with the investigation of the case.

item.title: ZELENSKY VS ZELENSKY
item.description:
10/27/22 A Ukrainian pensioner, with the same name as the president, blames Zelensky for the prolongation of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the villager, who never left his land, is now mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. This Zelensky, a villager, represents half the world that recriminates the other Zelensky, the villain, for not wanting to negotiate with Putin. Negotiate what? The invader enters our house, covers his wife and daughter (cf. recent UN report on the rapes in Ukraine, in this “special operation”), an act that forced us to watch, and then we say to him: hi there, we are for peace, but we have to negotiate: you still haven't said what name you want to give the children! A peace that is not dignified is nothing more than a cessation of rights. As serious as the Russophobia that Putin inflicts on his people.
10/28/22 At a lunch with several guests, I heard a friend, who declared herself a spiritualist, explaining the particularities of her belief, in a calm and balanced way, I would even say, without a hint of “irrationalism”. He spoke at length and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytism. “Here is someone whose belief has brought thoughtfulness!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at a certain moment a sentence comes out that horrifies me. It says, “there is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, and I glimpse the voracious maws of holism. Because holism has a pathological aspect, like all good things, a shadow side. Two examples: in Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is just an expression of rigorous karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts he committed in his previous life. In Africa, it is not accepted that death could have been accidental, and many women are accused by the family of the deceased of having caused the death of their husband, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, a huge injustice for the wife — madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism introduced Compassion and Christianity introduced Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a Platonic stage, where we are nothing more than the shadows of something — an inextricable law -, in a determinism that calcifies all singularities, but that strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity was anchored in the conquest of chance and randomness, removing the incidences of a life from this fierce determinism that enclosed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at that moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and its volition were able to emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “there is no such thing as chance, nothing happens by chance!”, which should function as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, however, this phrase is usually used to seek a reason for things outside of us, in others. It's an alibi. Today there is a holistic temptation in the world, just as there was a satanic temptation in the Middle Ages, without much reflection on its consequences. Because it's not enough to want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even for the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to that cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the fight” took place at the beginning of this century. One of the great mistakes of the 20th century was the false dichotomy between “rationalism and irrationalism”, a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality (the positive side of reason) was confused with rationalism (the pathological aspect of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment, irrationalism was confused with freedom. Almost all 20th century art, with Surrealism at its head, made this mistake. The fallacy still exists despite the emergence of “irrationalism” and the consequent relativist currents that followed it having been consolidated everywhere. Essentially, much of what happened in the 20th century revolved around this clash between two paradigms: Rationalism versus Irationalism. Now, I see, we must save indeterminacy, chance, randomness from the terrible temptation of the cage of causalities. Holism, in its pathological form, may be reductionism that sets itself up as a new “eschatological narrative”. Is it “by chance” that holism emerges at a time when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person is besieging everything, all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic awareness has brought a positive impact to greater ecological awareness, but followed with scholastic rigor, it stifles reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than uncomfortable: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that each moment asks of us — but how many will make the distinction, under a Law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will abandon themselves to what is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic awareness, as the Greeks knew, but it also brings agency and the courage of decision. And we cannot give up on this. Furthermore, as Drummond shows in the poem “Quadrilha”, by Carlos Drummond de Andrade: «João loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who didn't love anyone./ João went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of a disaster, Maria stayed with her aunt,/ Joaquim committed suicide and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story.» Real always runs outside the track, completely outside our concepts. That's what matters to us — a J. Pinto Fernandes emerges at the exact moment when we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: From Nobel and others
item.description: 9/10/22 When reading many people's reactions when this year's Nobel Prize for Literature was announced, I couldn't help but remember this comment from Jean-Pierre Siméon, in relation to another Nobel Prize: «An editor of a large national daily newspaper wrote five lines of indignation at the fact that the Nobel Prize for Literature had been awarded to Thomas Traströmer, a complete stranger. But unknown to whom? How did it not occur to this literary columnist, patented and paid to do his job, that his apparent ignorance was a matter of professional misconduct? Tranströmer had been translated into many languages, it was available in French.» There is always the chorus of those who wait for the Prize to be announced to complain about not having been invited to be on the jury, there is a subgroup of angry people who profess “I have never read it and I won’t even bother to read it”; It is a less than humble fauna, the one that inhabits social networks. I don't always know all the winners – I didn't know about the existence of Louise Glück, who I think is a great poet, or Olga Tokarczuk, for example – but this only brings me the comfort of knowing that the world is not a soap opera where everyone knows everyone else and the joy of recognizing that the yardstick of the world is not measured with my short measure and that, on the contrary, it gives me a new opportunity to face the unknown and learn from it. And perhaps the most stupid reaction was that of the intelligent man who wrote, But are there still people who read French?; simply confirming that today there is a new type of ignorance that is being raised with abandon: that of those who only read English. I would also prefer that, in French, Pascal Quignard, Linda Lê or even Sollers were awarded, or, among the new ones, Mathias Énard, but that does not detract from the dignity of Annie Ernaux's work (and it would have been enough to have written “Les Années”). There are books of hers that I like less, like the vulgar “Uma Paixão Simples”, but that happens with almost all authors, they have pivotal books and others that are like breaks in their itinerary. I recommend reading a beautiful book of interviews with her, “L’écriture comme un couteau”. 11/10/22 Yesterday an article appeared in the morning newspaper “Notícias”, in Maputo, reporting that the Pen Club Narrative Prize had been awarded to my wife, Teresa Noronha, for her soap opera “Tornado”, which had already won the Maria Velho da Costa Prize. The summary they made of the book does not even deserve comments, as it is pathetic, but what is important to highlight is the note of disqualification regarding its “Mozambicanness” when they call it Luso-Mozambican. It's not that it's inaccurate, but, for those who know the context, it's a touch naughty. Because finally, following the same logic, Adelino Timóteo should be called Tsonga-Mozambican, Álvaro Taruma Ronga-Mozambican, and Macua-Mozambican for writers from the north, etc., etc. Which doesn't appear to happen. At one point, in the novel, she writes: «Our color was never the dominant one. In colonial times we were not white, we were dressed in monhés, mugs of washed asses, the pejorative term to speak of a son of Goan and Portuguese. In the post-colonial period, I was not black and if, in Lisbon, they took me for Brazilian or Cape Verdean, in France they were lost in thought about where I was from and were surprised when they discovered that I was African. There I had to explain the wanderings of my DNA before settling in Mozambique. It took me a long time to accept that it was like that because yes, and that it was no curse that that was the case; on the contrary, I could even discover intense patterns of fantasy and freedom in this harlequin cloak that is our genealogy…” In modern-day Mozambique, it means being white… and that immediately takes precedence over what you do or what you are. It's sad, but as Naipaul warned, in these parts race is everything and people live as deeply immersed in it as, in other places, in religion. 12/10/22 Bruno Latour, an anthropologist who studied the sciences and their procedures and legitimations, law, technique and religions and who entertained himself by turning his back on the dogmas of the “moderns”, has died. For him, the place, the role of the specialist, was defined more by the perplexity he embodied than by the supposed truth that would sustain him. He proposed, as an alternative to the goodness of multiculturalism and its equivocal cliché “all different, all equal”, a return to “diplomacy”, given that this, precisely, does not start from the assumption that “we are unified because we share the same nature” but simply highlights that we “still do not share a common world”; It is necessary that we deal head-on with the “abyss of disagreement” that separates us, instead of trying to deceive it. And about politics he said, boldly: «If transparency is demanded from politicians, we kill them; if anyone demands fidelity to what the other was or what he says, kill him; If a mimetic relationship is required between what the crowd wants and what its representative says, representation is killed. These must therefore, by definition, betray, deceive, modify, distort the word. Without this ability to bend the word and betray, political language would not exist. I put forward the perfectly plausible hypothesis that political vocabulary will become as inaccessible as the religious language of the last twenty, three or fifty years.» (in “Un Monde Pluriel mais Commun”). I believe we will be needed to decipher this frantically complex world that has fallen to us.

item.title: Fuxi
item.description: O my friends, companions of these disastrous journeys through countries as old as the stars and the Moon, and as strange as the deepest interior of our wretched souls, what surprises still await us, what secret magics will we still have to overcome, what horrors will arise before our pupils dilated with astonishment and terror? Increasingly closer to our precarious existences, howls the monster of war, which threatens to merge humanity once and for all with the earth, incessantly traversed by the squalid specter of hunger and the invisible evil of ten thousand pestilences. Oh damned human, who believes you are superior to Nature itself, but then you reveal yourself, time and time again, incapable of simply ordering your existence and do not understand that you are possessed by fickle anger and are a slave to your own ambition! You are not satisfied with white jade or resplendent gold, there is no treasure that quenches your inextinguishable thirst for command over other men, animals and things; for eternal anguish dwells in you; in you the expelled serpents crawl; for you grows, powerful and impressive, the most fertile ivy of Evil! This is perhaps why on the Mount they call the White Deer, where one of the eight immortals on a sacred mount soared through the heavens towards Penglai, lives the fuxi, a bird whose shape resembles that of a rooster, although topped by a human head. What strange copulations, what monstrous embraces, what terrible procedures must have occurred to make the existence of this sinister animal possible? We don't know, but all it takes is for our exhausted mind to dare to come up with an answer, and then we feel our skin covered in horrendous goosebumps and our heart races in parade, like a wild horse whipped by the night whip of fear, unresponsive to reins and containment. Men should refrain from visiting Monte do Veado, because although there are riches capable of calming the wildest ambitions, if they have the unfortunate luck of catching a glimpse of a fuxi, it is certain that a war will soon break out and the cultivated fields will perish because of it, tame animals will be beheaded, because of it the best young men of two generations will be sacrificed and the land will be destroyed. pride of countries. The fuxi makes a sound reminiscent of its name. If you hear it, dark night or clear day, be on your way, because the path you are on is the surest path to misfortune!

item.title: Procrastinators Club
item.description: While rereading Easter, because of an article I'm preparing, I come across this excerpt, taken from “The Universal Man”: «Each man, morally, is one and absolute; but he has to live with attenuating his personality. (…) Coexistence is only possible between people reduced to a negative or hollow presence, which constantly gives way. Hence, the emptiness of society, an immense ghost made up of countless dead people. A superior man is antisocial or criminal. His destiny is prison and the desert”. I hesitate to think whether Pascoaes reflects here on the political-social conditions that muzzle, and, worse, in a sad country like Portugal in the middle of the Estado Novo (and the book is from 1931) where any possibilities of spontaneity and frankness in human relationships were limited, or if it simply lends to the behavior of (oppressed) men a metaphysical framework, an “essence”, declared in the presumption of each one. to be, in isolation, “one and absolute”. Sometimes, in addition to an excess of Spirituality (or Saudade), Pascoaes lacks the world. He is a great poet, but he is a poet who takes Ampoules-of-Great-Ideas and who therefore writes often trapped by a programmatic furor, ceasing to have pores; It is not uncommon for a glass to be erected between him and reality, the same glass that made him write in O Bailado, from 1921: «Everything is a ghost. There are only clouds, clouds of voices, clouds of souls, of afflictions and tragedies! Clouds and more clouds, appearances and more appearances! And a divine lightning that pierces them, the instantaneous Apparition that appears and throws us to the ground, dazzled!» Sometimes I felt like reminding him, as António Sérgio did, in the article “Regeneration and Tradition, Moral and Economy”, which he dedicated to Pascoaes: «Pascoais, Pascoais my dear friend: you are a pure, excellent and noble poet, but also a victim of this social environment, like us all: of this horrible isolation that you praise and I curse». «As a child, he stole two blackbirds», says Jacinto do Prado Coelho, he stole them from a nest, and he felt remorse for that all his life. The Person, few more mischiefs are known to him. Only in Álvaro de Campos does a hint of wickedness and obscenity emerge: «Ah, and the ordinary and dirty people, who always look the same,/ Who use swear words as usual words,/ Whose sons steal from grocery store doors/ And whose daughters at the age of eight – and I think this is beautiful and I love it! –/ Decent-looking men masturbate in stairwells.” (Triumphal ode). Both poets, driven by a certain idea of ​​sanctity, had the same inability to break the siege of their skin with the overflow of someone else's dam, the same curse of sublimating the concrete ferocity of eros with the gentleness of the verses. Obviously, they are both “bigger than life”, but sometimes it makes me unnerved to watch, from my position as a hatter at the Procrastinators Club, the tantrums between them, just to see who occupies, in the internal organization, the place of President and Treasurer. Although Pessoa guessed more things, for example, what he wrote in the lesser-known Ode Martial and which is reflected in the situation we live in today, in a different way, with his heart in his hands: «MARTIAL ODE (…) Helahoho! helahoho! The poor widow's sewing machine who was bayoneted... She sewed indefinitely in the afternoon… The table where the old people played, Everything mixed, everything mixed with bodies, with blood, All one river, one wave, one dragging horror. Helahoho! helahoho! I unearthed the child's tin train pressed into the middle of the [road, And I cried like all the mothers in the world about the horror of life. My pantheistic feet tripped over the sewing machine [widow who was killed with a bayonet And that poor instrument of peace stuck a spear in my heart. Yes, I was the one to blame for everything, I was the soldier for them all Who killed, raped, burned and broke, It was me and my shame and my remorse like a shadow [deformed They travel around the world like Ashavero, But behind my steps there are footsteps the size of infinity And a physical fear of being accountable to God makes me close my eyes. [eyes suddenly. (…) I ordered, captain, to shoot the trembling peasants, I let the daughters of all fathers tied to trees be raped, Now I saw that it was inside my heart that all this happened, And everything scalds and suffocates and I can't move without it [everything be the same. God have mercy on me, I didn't have it from anyone! LÀ-BAS, JE NE SAIS OÙ…” What is clear today, at this disastrous moment in which Cristiano & Companhia failed in their mission in Braga, and in which the self-sabotage of Russia's gas pipelines reminds us that Putin will indeed be willing to do anything to maintain dominance over the areas endorsed, is that, bomb for bomb, the “bomb” of the Fifth Empire was preferable. However, even in this, my dears, we were irresolute, a little more on the side of piella than determined, and we procrastinated.

item.title: Russia | Sergei Lavrov rejects ending the war
item.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov yesterday rejected the possibility of Russia ending the fighting in Ukraine, arguing that it would mean giving up the reasons why the conflict was started. “If we simply stop, it will mean forgetting the original causes of the conflict,” Lavrov said at a press conference held ahead of the Budapest summit between Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump, which could take place next week. "Now we hear from Washington that we must immediately stop [the war] and that we must not discuss anything further. Stop and let History judge," Lavrov added. In his opinion, the cessation of hostilities would constitute “a contradiction” in relation to what was agreed at the August summit in Alaska between the two leaders, and he accused the Europeans of trying to convince the White House to change its position and not seek a “lasting agreement”. "We know who is doing this. They are the Europeans, the sponsors and masters of [the Ukrainian President, Volodymyr Zelensky", he pointed out. The Russian minister recalled that Putin and Trump agreed in Alaska to “focus on the root causes and the need for Ukraine to abandon the attempt to join NATO and, if possible, fully guarantee the legitimate rights of the Russian and Russophone population”. Lavrov added that “a ceasefire now would mean only one thing: much of Ukraine would remain under Kiev’s Nazi regime.” “That part of Ukraine,” he continued, “would be the only place on Earth where an entire language would be banned by law, not to mention the fact that it is an official UN language and spoken by the majority of the population.” Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump are expected to meet in Hungary to find a solution to the war in Ukraine. Step by step Dimitri Peskov, on the other hand, said he hoped that the summit would serve to “advance a peaceful agreement” on Ukraine, but did not comment on the possibility of his Ukrainian counterpart participating in the meeting. Peskov said that Moscow intends to “move forward, first and foremost, on a peaceful agreement on Ukraine” at the meeting in Budapest, where Zelensky expressed interest in attending if invited. The Russian diplomat also expressed surprise at the news from the United States — reported by CNN television — about a possible postponement of his meeting with the US Secretary of State, Marco Rubio, with whom he spoke on the phone yesterday. However, he acknowledged that, in their telephone conversation, they never discussed the meeting, but only the possibility of speaking again. The CNN news was also mentioned in the daily press conference of the Russian presidential spokesman. “You cannot postpone something that was not scheduled,” observed Dmitri Peskov.

item.title: Japan | Sanae Takaichi elected first woman to lead the Government
item.description: Japan's new leader is known for her conservative positions. It comes to power thanks to an alliance with the right-wing reformist party, Ishin, but does not have an absolute majority in the Japanese parliament Nationalist Sanae Takaichi was appointed Prime Minister of Japan yesterday, becoming the first woman to hold this position, thanks to a parliamentary coalition formed the day before, after last-minute negotiations. The Lower House of the Japanese Parliament nominated Takaichi, 64, in the first vote and his appointment will be made official when he meets with Emperor Naruhito. The fifth leader of the archipelago in the same number of years faces a delicate political situation in the country, but also a dense international agenda, whose first highlight is the visit to Japan by US President Donald Trump, next week. On October 4, Sanae Takaichi won the presidency of the Liberal Democratic Party (PLD), the right-wing conservative formation in power almost uninterruptedly since 1955, but which in recent months has lost its majority in both chambers of the Japanese Parliament due, in particular, to financial scandals. The PLD's traditional ally, the centrist Komeito party, abandoned the coalition in force since 1999, upset by the scandals and Sanae Takaichi's conservative views. To guarantee the election as head of the Government and succeed the outgoing Prime Minister, Shigeru Ishiba, Takaichi formed an alliance on Monday with the Japanese Innovation Party (Ishin), a center-right reformist formation. “Scandinavian style” The new leader of the Government of Japan, an admirer of former British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher, nicknamed the “Iron Lady”, promised an Executive with a “Scandinavian-style” number of women, in contrast to just two in her predecessor's team. One of them is expected to be Satsuki Katayama, former Minister of Regional Revitalization, who will occupy the position of Minister of Finance, according to the Japanese press. Japan is ranked 118th out of 148 in the World Economic Forum's 2025 report on gender disparity and the lower house of the Japanese Parliament is an example of this, with just 15 percent women. Takaichi wants to bring a new sensitivity to the difficulties related to women's health to the public policy agenda and does not hesitate to speak openly about her symptoms related to menopause. However, her political positions on gender equality place her to the right of an already conservative PLD. For example, the new head of the Executive opposes the revision of a law that forces couples to use the same surname and supports an imperial succession reserved for men. Takaichi will also face the fight against Japan's demographic decline and the recovery of the world's fourth largest economy. Furthermore, the coalition with Ishin represents 231 seats in Parliament, below the 233 needed for an absolute majority, meaning it will have to negotiate with other parties to govern. Sanae Takaichi has already spoken out in favor of increasing public spending to revive the economy, following the example of her mentor, former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, and her victory boosted the Tokyo Stock Exchange to reach record levels, mainly due to the “fiscal dove” reputation, with companies betting on a new cycle of tax cuts. On the foreign front, Takaichi also moderated his speech about China and, last week, prudently refrained from visiting the Yasukuni shrine, a symbol of Japan's militaristic past, aggressive against Japan's neighbors. At an internal level, finally, the first female leader of the PLD and inherently the first head of the Japanese Government's main challenge is to recover her party's popularity after a series of electoral setbacks that saw the rise of Sanseito, a small populist party that describes immigration as a “silent invasion”.

item.title: DeepSeek launches AI model that combines text and images to reduce computational costs
item.description: Chinese artificial intelligence company DeepSeek has introduced a new multimodal model that combines text and visual information to process extensive documents with fewer computational resources, the South China Morning Post announced yesterday. The system, called DeepSeek-OCR, uses visual perception as a means of compression to significantly reduce the number of tokens – the minimum units of text processed by linguistic models. According to the company, the method allows the text volume to be reduced by between seven and twenty times, making it possible to process large amounts of information without a significant increase in computational costs. Available in open source on the Hugging Face and GitHub platforms, the model is composed of a visual encoder (DeepEncoder) and a decoder with Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architecture, with 570 million parameters. In addition to recognizing text, the system can interpret visual elements such as tables, formulas and diagrams, which makes it applicable in areas such as finance, scientific research and document analysis. Way ahead In the company's published tests, DeepSeek-OCR outperformed other optical character recognition (OCR) models such as GOT-OCR 2.0 and MinerU 2.0 by maintaining 97 percent accuracy with less than ten times compression. DeepSeek guarantees that the system can generate more than 200,000 pages of training data per day using just an Nvidia A100-40G graphics card. The launch is part of the Hangzhou-based company's strategy of developing more efficient and lower-cost models, alongside the previous V3 and R1 models, focused on reasoning and reinforcement learning. DeepSeek integrates the new generation of Chinese open source artificial intelligence developers, alongside companies such as Baidu, Tencent or Alibaba. However, experts warn that strict content control rules in China could limit the international expansion of these systems.

item.title: HK | Sany will debut on the stock exchange for 1,375 MME
item.description: Chinese construction machinery manufacturer Sany will enter the Hong Kong stock exchange on October 28, with a transaction worth 1.6 billion dollars, reinforcing the dynamism of the local market. Sany, which is already listed in Shanghai, plans to sell more than 580 million shares for a total value of 12,360 million Hong Kong dollars, the local press reported yesterday. The company manufactures excavators, concrete machinery, lifting platforms, drilling and compaction equipment, and pavers, currently occupying third place in the sector worldwide. With 62 percent of its turnover coming from abroad, Sany continues to consider China its main market, but warned of the risks arising from the prolonged crisis in the Chinese real estate sector. According to the South China Morning Post, the company will channel 45 percent of the funds raised to expand its international sales and technical support network. The same source highlights that next week will be marked by three other major initial public offerings (IPO) in Hong Kong: CIG Shanghai, a manufacturer of connectivity devices, with an operation valued at US$595 million; the artificial intelligence solutions company Deepexi, with 91 million dollars; and the tea brand Bama Tea, with 58 million. These launches, combined with around 290 active IPO applications registered in September, place the Hong Kong stock exchange as a strong candidate for the title of the world's leading market for stock market debuts in 2025. Among the most anticipated upcoming debuts are those of the two main Chinese operators of autonomous vehicles ('robotaxis'), Pony.ai and WeRide, which could raise up to 2,300 and 1,100 million of dollars.

item.title: Trump announced he will visit China “early next year”
item.description: US President Donald Trump announced Monday that he will travel to China “early next year” to meet his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping. "I've been invited to China and I'll probably go early next year. It's pretty much all organized," Trump told reporters, alongside Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, whom he received at the White House. Trump is expected to meet Xi in person at the end of this month, on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in South Korea, in what will be the first bilateral meeting since 2019. The meeting was at risk due to tensions between the two countries due to controls announced by Beijing on the export of rare earths, as well as machines and technologies that allow their refinement and transformation. In response, Trump threatened to increase tariffs on Beijing after what he described as an “extremely aggressive” decision by China. Trump also expressed Monday, on the same occasion and in the presence of journalists, doubts about a possible Chinese invasion of Taiwan. "I think everything will go well with China. China doesn't want to do that," he said. Peace and defense Also on Monday, Taiwanese leader William Lai stated that peace between China and Taiwan cannot be achieved “with a simple agreement”, in statements following the election of the new leader of the Kuomintang opposition party, which is in favor of dialogue with Beijing. In a speech addressed to representatives of the Taiwanese diaspora, Lai argued that both he and his predecessor, Tsai Ing-wen (2016-2024), were committed to “strengthening national defense”, since “peace must be an ideal, but not an illusion”. "Peace cannot be achieved through a simple agreement. Nor can peace be achieved by accepting China's proposals, such as the so-called '1992 Consensus' or the 'one China' principle", he declared, referring to the tacit understanding between the KMT and the Chinese Communist Party (CCP), according to which both recognize the existence of "one China", albeit with different interpretations.

item.title: Hong Kong | Welcomed multilateral entity dedicated to international mediation
item.description: The mediation body should, according to the Chief Executive, John Lee, have a status similar to that of the International Court of Justice The International Organization for Mediation (IOMed) formally began activities in Hong Kong yesterday, with representatives from more than 30 countries, asserting itself as the first multilateral body dedicated to international mediation. Hong Kong's Chief Executive, John Lee, had already stated in May that the new entity would have a status “similar to that of the International Court of Justice” in The Hague, due to its role as a dispute resolution center, which, according to him, “will reinforce the city's external prestige, generate economic advantages and consolidate the rule of law”. During the inauguration ceremony, Chinese Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs Hua Chunying highlighted that the IOMed Convention was signed, came into force and allowed the formal creation of the organization in just five months, which she considered a “historical record” and proof of international support for the initiative, according to the official newspaper Diário do Povo. Linked to the Global Governance Initiative promoted by Beijing, the new organization “promotes conciliation, equity and cooperation, giving a constructive impetus to a more integrated international community,” said Hua. The local government highlighted that, in an international context of uncertainty and tensions, mediation gains relevance as a mechanism to preserve relationships and encourage dialogue. “Hong Kong, with highly qualified professionals, will lead this task”, declared John Lee. It is the first intergovernmental body dedicated exclusively to the mediation of transnational disputes, offering its own dispute resolution mechanisms, promoting updated methods and hosting international meetings, with special attention to developing countries. Legal framework IOMed will also seek to cooperate with other multilateral entities, as stipulated in the Convention signed in May.
